vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-8177
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to CVE-2020-8177 curl overwrite local file with -J
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-8177)
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-8177)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Exhaustion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Git through 2.14.2 mishandles layers of tree objects, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted repository, aka a Git bomb. This can also have an impact of disk consumption; however, an affected process typically would not survive its attempt to build the data structure in memory before writing to disk.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15298)
- [MISC](https://github.com/Katee/git-bomb)
- [MISC](https://kate.io/blog/git-bomb/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15298)
- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3829-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: git/git-man
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
GIT version 2.15.1 and earlier contains a Input Validation Error vulnerability in Client that can result in problems including messing up terminal configuration to RCE. This attack appear to be exploitable via The user must interact with a malicious git server, (or have their traffic modified in a MITM attack).

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000021)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000021)
- [http://www.batterystapl.es/2018/01/security-implications-of-ansi-escape.html](http://www.batterystapl.es/2018/01/security-implications-of-ansi-escape.html)
vulnerabilities.name: git/git-man
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:

A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Git for Visual Studio improperly sanitizes input, aka 'Git for Visual Studio Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2019-1349, CVE-2019-1350, CVE-2019-1352, CVE-2019-1387.

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1354)

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16868)
- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00017.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00068.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16868)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106080)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16868)
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a "BEAST" attack.

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A vulnerability was found in gnutls versions from 3.5.8 before 3.6.7. A memory corruption (double free) vulnerability in the certificate verification API. Any client or server application that verifies X.509 certificates with GnuTLS 3.5.8 or later is affected.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. An issue was discovered in GnuTLS before 3.6.15. A server can trigger a NULL pointer dereference in a TLS 1.3 client if a no_renegotiation alert is sent with unexpected timing, and then an invalid second handshake occurs. The crash happens in the application's error handling path, where the gnutls_deinit function is called after detecting a handshake failure.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `gnutls28`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-24659)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200911-0006/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/62BUAI4FQQLG6VTKRT7SUZPGJJ4NASQ3/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202009-01)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/-/issues/1071)
- [MISC](https://www.gnutls.org/security-new.html#GNUTLS-SA-2020-09-04)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4491-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16868)
- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00017.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00068.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16868)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106080)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16868)
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a "BEAST" attack.

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A vulnerability was found in gnutls versions from 3.5.8 before 3.6.7. A memory corruption (double free) vulnerability in the certificate verification API. Any client or server application that verifies X.509 certificates with GnuTLS 3.5.8 or later is affected.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/issues/694)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. An issue was discovered in GnuTLS before 3.6.15. A server can trigger a NULL pointer dereference in a TLS 1.3 client if a no_renegotiation alert is sent with unexpected timing, and then an invalid second handshake occurs. The crash happens in the application's error handling path, where the gnutls_deinit function is called after detecting a handshake failure.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `gnutls28`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-24659)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200911-0006/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/62BUAI4FQQLG6VTKRT7SUZPGJJ4NASQ3/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202009-01)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/-/issues/1071)
- [MISC](https://www.gnutls.org/security-new.html#GNUTLS-SA-2020-09-04)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4491-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16868)
- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00017.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00068.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16868)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106080)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16868)
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a "BEAST" attack.

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A vulnerability was found in gnutls versions from 3.5.8 before 3.6.7. A memory corruption (double free) vulnerability in the certificate verification API. Any client or server application that verifies X.509 certificates with GnuTLS 3.5.8 or later is affected.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/issues/694)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. An issue was discovered in GnuTLS before 3.6.15. A server can trigger a NULL pointer dereference in a TLS 1.3 client if a no_renegotiation alert is sent with unexpected timing, and then an invalid second handshake occurs. The crash happens in the application's error handling path, where the gnutls_deinit function is called after detecting a handshake failure.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `gnutls28`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-24659)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200911-0006/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/62BUAI4FQQLG6VTKRT7SUZPGJJ4NASQ3/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202009-01)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/-/issues/1071)
- [MISC](https://www.gnutls.org/security-new.html#GNUTLS-SA-2020-09-04)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4491-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16868)
- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00017.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00068.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16868)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106080)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16868)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a "BEAST" attack.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8598)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11462)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2FPRUP4YVOEBGEROUYWZFEQ64HTMGNED/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/56f7b1bc95a2a3eeb420e069e7655fb181ade5cf)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1488873)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-11462)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)
- [Oval Security](https://oval.cisecurity.org/repository/search/definition/oval%3Aorg.mitre.oval%3Adef%3A10497)
- [REDHAT](http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-012.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](http://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=136304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/11289)
- [TRUSTIX](http://www.trustix.org/errata/2004/0050)
- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/17583)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5729)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551083)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5729)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References

- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551083)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8598)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)

- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/17583)

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)

- [TRUSTIX](http://www.trustix.org/errata/2004/0050)
- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/17583)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5729)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551083)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5729)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)
- [Oval Security](https://oval.cisecurity.org/repository/search/definition/oval%3Aorg.mitre.oval%3Adef%3A10497)
- [REDHAT](http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-012.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](http://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=136304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/11289)
- [TRUSTIX](http://www.trustix.org/errata/2004/0050)
- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/17583)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8598)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11462)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2FPRUP4YVOEBGEROUYWZFEQ64HTMGNED/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/56f7b1bc95a2a3eeb420e069e7655fb181ade5cf)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1488873)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-11462)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)
- [Oval Security](https://oval.cisecurity.org/repository/search/definition/oval%3Aorg.mitre.oval%3Adef%3A10497)
- [REDHAT](http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-012.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](http://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=136304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/11289)
- [TRUSTIX](http://www.trustix.org/errata/2004/0050)
- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/17583)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5729)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551083)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5729)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)

- [TRUSTIX](http://www.trustix.org/errata/2004/0050)
- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/17583)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References

- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)

- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551083)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)

- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)

MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)

- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
