vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5729)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551083)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5729)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)

- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)

- [TRUSTIX](http://www.trustix.org/errata/2004/0050)
- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/17583)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)

A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8598)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11462)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2FPRUP4YVOEBGEROUYWZFEQ64HTMGNED/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/56f7b1bc95a2a3eeb420e069e7655fb181ade5cf)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1488873)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-11462)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)
- [Oval Security](https://oval.cisecurity.org/repository/search/definition/oval%3Aorg.mitre.oval%3Adef%3A10497)
- [REDHAT](http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-012.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](http://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=136304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/11289)
- [TRUSTIX](http://www.trustix.org/errata/2004/0050)
- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/17583)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssrpc4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)

- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)

- [TRUSTIX](http://www.trustix.org/errata/2004/0050)
- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/17583)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkadm5clnt-mit11
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkadm5clnt-mit11
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkadm5clnt-mit11
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkdb5-8
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkadm5srv-mit11
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkadm5srv-mit11
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkadm5srv-mit11
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/krb5-multidev
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5710)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5710)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Denial%20Of%20Service%28DoS%29)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5710)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-dev
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5730)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GK5T6JPMBHBPKS7HNGHYUUF4KKRMNSNU/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OIFUL3CPM4S5TOXTTOCQ3CUZN6XCXUTR/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/e1caf6fb74981da62039846931ebdffed71309d1)
- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:0327)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1551082)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1042071)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5730)

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References

- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3071)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5-dev
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
plugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libk5crypto3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2004-0971
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The krb5-send-pr script in the kerberos5 (krb5) package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0971)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200410-24.xml)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libk5crypto3
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=891869)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In libssh2 before 1.9.0, kex_method_diffie_hellman_group_exchange_sha256_key_exchange in kex.c has an integer overflow that could lead to an out-of-bounds read in the way packets are read from the server. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to disclose sensitive information or cause a denial of service condition on the client system when a user connects to the server. This is related to an _libssh2_check_length mistake, and is different from the various issues fixed in 1.8.1, such as CVE-2019-3855.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190806-0002/)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K13322484)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K13322484?utm_source=f5support&amp%3Butm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/07/msg00024.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13115)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6LUNHPW64IGCASZ4JQ2J5KDXNZN53DWW/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/M7IF3LNHOA75O4WZWIHJLIRMA5LJUED3/)
- [GitHub Diff](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/compare/02ecf17...42d37aa)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/pull/350)
- [MISC](https://blog.semmle.com/libssh2-integer-overflow/)
- [MISC](https://libssh2.org/changes.html)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13115)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In libssh2 v1.9.0 and earlier versions, the SSH_MSG_DISCONNECT logic in packet.c has an integer overflow in a bounds check, enabling an attacker to specify an arbitrary (out-of-bounds) offset for a subsequent memory read. A crafted SSH server may be able to disclose sensitive information or cause a denial of service condition on the client system when a user connects to the server.

## References
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/11/msg00010.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-17498)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/TY7EEE34RFKCTXTMBQQWWSLXZWSCXNDB/)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/kevinbackhouse/SecurityExploits/tree/8cbdbbe6363510f7d9ceec685373da12e6fc752d/libssh2/out_of_bounds_read_disconnect_CVE-2019-17498)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/pull/402/commits/1c6fa92b77e34d089493fe6d3e2c6c8775858b94)
- [MISC](https://blog.semmle.com/libssh2-integer-overflow-CVE-2019-17498/)
- [MISC](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/blob/42d37aa63129a1b2644bf6495198923534322d64/src/packet.c%23L480)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-11/msg00026.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libssh2/libssh2-1
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way nettle handles endian conversion of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run a process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this flaw extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16869)
- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16869)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106092)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16869)
vulnerabilities.name: nettle/libhogweed4
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
nghttp2 version >= 1.10.0 and nghttp2 <= v1.31.0 contains an Improper Input Validation CWE-20 vulnerability in ALTSVC frame handling that can result in segmentation fault leading to denial of service. This attack appears to be exploitable via network client. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in >= 1.31.1.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://nghttp2.org/blog/2018/04/12/nghttp2-v1-31-1/)
- [CONFIRM](https://nodejs.org/en/blog/vulnerability/june-2018-security-releases/)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000168)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000168)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:0366)
- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:0367)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103952)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000168)
vulnerabilities.name: nghttp2/libnghttp2-14

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
slapd in OpenLDAP 2.4.45 and earlier creates a PID file after dropping privileges to a non-root account, which might allow local users to kill arbitrary processes by leveraging access to this non-root account for PID file modification before a root script executes a "kill `cat /pathname`" command, as demonstrated by openldap-initscript.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-14159)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-14159)
- [MISC](http://www.openldap.org/its/index.cgi?findid=8703)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-14159)
vulnerabilities.name: openldap/libldap-2.4-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The nss_parse_ciphers function in libraries/libldap/tls_m.c in OpenLDAP does not properly parse OpenSSL-style multi-keyword mode cipher strings, which might cause a weaker than intended cipher to be used and allow remote attackers to have unspecified impact via unknown vectors.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-3276)
- [Oracle Security Bulletin](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/linuxbulletinoct2015-2719645.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1238322)
- [RedHat Security Advisory](http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-2131.html)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1034221)
vulnerabilities.name: openldap/libldap-2.4-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
contrib/slapd-modules/nops/nops.c in OpenLDAP through 2.4.45, when both the nops module and the memberof overlay are enabled, attempts to free a buffer that was allocated on the stack, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (slapd crash) via a member MODDN operation.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-17740)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-17740)
- [MISC](http://www.openldap.org/its/index.cgi/Incoming?id=8759)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00053.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00058.html)
vulnerabilities.name: openldap/libldap-2.4-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Certificate Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Certificate Validation libldap in certain third-party OpenLDAP packages has a certificate-validation flaw when the third-party package is asserting RFC6125 support. It considers CN even when there is a non-matching subjectAltName (SAN). This is fixed in, for example, openldap-2.4.46-10.el8 in Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `openldap`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-15719)
- [MISC](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:3674)
- [MISC](https://bugs.openldap.org/show_bug.cgi?id=9266)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1740070)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00033.html)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00059.html)
vulnerabilities.name: openldap/libldap-2.4-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
slapd in OpenLDAP 2.4.45 and earlier creates a PID file after dropping privileges to a non-root account, which might allow local users to kill arbitrary processes by leveraging access to this non-root account for PID file modification before a root script executes a "kill `cat /pathname`" command, as demonstrated by openldap-initscript.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-14159)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-14159)
- [MISC](http://www.openldap.org/its/index.cgi?findid=8703)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-14159)
vulnerabilities.name: openldap/libldap-2.4-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The nss_parse_ciphers function in libraries/libldap/tls_m.c in OpenLDAP does not properly parse OpenSSL-style multi-keyword mode cipher strings, which might cause a weaker than intended cipher to be used and allow remote attackers to have unspecified impact via unknown vectors.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-3276)
- [Oracle Security Bulletin](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/linuxbulletinoct2015-2719645.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1238322)
- [RedHat Security Advisory](http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-2131.html)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1034221)
vulnerabilities.name: openldap/libldap-2.4-2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
contrib/slapd-modules/nops/nops.c in OpenLDAP through 2.4.45, when both the nops module and the memberof overlay are enabled, attempts to free a buffer that was allocated on the stack, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (slapd crash) via a member MODDN operation.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-17740)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-17740)
- [MISC](http://www.openldap.org/its/index.cgi/Incoming?id=8759)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00053.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00058.html)

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Certificate Validation libldap in certain third-party OpenLDAP packages has a certificate-validation flaw when the third-party package is asserting RFC6125 support. It considers CN even when there is a non-matching subjectAltName (SAN). This is fixed in, for example, openldap-2.4.46-10.el8 in Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `openldap`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-15719)
- [MISC](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:3674)
- [MISC](https://bugs.openldap.org/show_bug.cgi?id=9266)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1740070)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00033.html)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00059.html)
vulnerabilities.name: openldap/libldap-common
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. Perl before 5.30.3 has an integer overflow related to mishandling of a "PL_regkind[OP(n)] == NOTHING" situation. A crafted regular expression could lead to malformed bytecode with a possibility of instruction injection.
## Remediation
Upgrade `perl` to version  or higher.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/Perl/perl5/blob/blead/pod/perl5303delta.pod)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/perl/perl5/commit/0a320d753fe7fca03df259a4dfd8e641e51edaa8)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/perl/perl5/commit/3295b48defa0f8570114877b063fe546dd348b3c)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/Perl/perl5/compare/v5.30.2...v5.30.3)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0001/)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10878)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IN3TTBO5KSGWE5IRIKDJ5JSQRH7ANNXE/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-03)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-06/msg00044.html)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10878)
vulnerabilities.name: perl
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Buffer Overflow
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Buffer Overflow regcomp.c in Perl before 5.30.3 allows a buffer overflow via a crafted regular expression because of recursive S_study_chunk calls.
## Remediation
Upgrade `perl` to version  or higher.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/Perl/perl5/blob/blead/pod/perl5303delta.pod)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/perl/perl5/commit/66bbb51b93253a3f87d11c2695cfb7bdb782184a)

- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0001/)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. Perl before 5.30.3 on 32-bit platforms allows a heap-based buffer overflow because nested regular expression quantifiers have an integer overflow.
## Remediation
Upgrade `perl` to version  or higher.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/Perl/perl5/blob/blead/pod/perl5303delta.pod)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
fileio.c in Vim prior to 8.0.1263 sets the group ownership of a .swp file to the editor's primary group (which may be different from the group ownership of the original file), which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by leveraging an applicable group membership, as demonstrated by /etc/shadow owned by root:shadow mode 0640, but /etc/.shadow.swp owned by root:users mode 0640, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-1000382.

## References
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/08/msg00003.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-17087)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5a73e0ca54c77e067c3b12ea6f35e3e8681e8cf8)
- [MISC](http://security.cucumberlinux.com/security/details.php?id=166)
- [MISC](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/vim_dev/sRT9BtjLWMk/BRtSXNU4BwAJ)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/11/27/2)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-17087)
vulnerabilities.name: vim/xxd
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Credentials Management
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
autoload/netrw.vim (aka the Netrw Plugin) 109, 131, and other versions before 133k for Vim 7.1.266, other 7.1 versions, and 7.2 stores credentials for an FTP session, and sends those credentials when attempting to establish subsequent FTP sessions to servers on different hosts, which allows remote FTP servers to obtain sensitive information in opportunistic circumstances by logging usernames and passwords.  NOTE: the upstream vendor disputes a vector involving different ports on the same host, stating "I'm assuming that they're using the same id and password on that unchanged hostname, deliberately."

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2008-4677)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/10/06/4)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/10/16/2)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/10/20/2)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2009-03/msg00004.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=461750)
- [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/31464)
- [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/34418)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/30670)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
VIM version 8.0.1187 (and other versions most likely) ignores umask when creating a swap file ("[ORIGINAL_FILENAME].swp") resulting in files that may be world readable or otherwise accessible in ways not intended by the user running the vi binary.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-1000382)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/10/31/1)
- [http://security.cucumberlinux.com/security/details.php?id=120](http://security.cucumberlinux.com/security/details.php?id=120)
vulnerabilities.name: vim/xxd
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: OS Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to OS Command Injection. In Vim before 8.1.0881, users can circumvent the rvim restricted mode and execute arbitrary OS commands via scripting interfaces (e.g., Python, Ruby, or Lua).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `vim`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20807)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211289)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20807)
- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Jul/24)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8c62a08faf89663e5633dc5036cd8695c80f1075)
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/vim/vim/releases/tag/v8.1.0881)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-06/msg00018.html)
vulnerabilities.name: vim/xxd
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
fileio.c in Vim prior to 8.0.1263 sets the group ownership of a .swp file to the editor's primary group (which may be different from the group ownership of the original file), which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by leveraging an applicable group membership, as demonstrated by /etc/shadow owned by root:shadow mode 0640, but /etc/.shadow.swp owned by root:users mode 0640, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-1000382.

## References
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/08/msg00003.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-17087)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5a73e0ca54c77e067c3b12ea6f35e3e8681e8cf8)
- [MISC](http://security.cucumberlinux.com/security/details.php?id=166)
- [MISC](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/vim_dev/sRT9BtjLWMk/BRtSXNU4BwAJ)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/11/27/2)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-17087)
vulnerabilities.name: vim/vim-common
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git vim && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

vulnerabilities.title: Credentials Management
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
autoload/netrw.vim (aka the Netrw Plugin) 109, 131, and other versions before 133k for Vim 7.1.266, other 7.1 versions, and 7.2 stores credentials for an FTP session, and sends those credentials when attempting to establish subsequent FTP sessions to servers on different hosts, which allows remote FTP servers to obtain sensitive information in opportunistic circumstances by logging usernames and passwords.  NOTE: the upstream vendor disputes a vector involving different ports on the same host, stating "I'm assuming that they're using the same id and password on that unchanged hostname, deliberately."

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2008-4677)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/10/06/4)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/10/16/2)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/10/20/2)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2009-03/msg00004.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=461750)
- [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/31464)
- [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/34418)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/30670)
- [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/44419)
- [http://groups.google.com/group/vim_dev/browse_thread/thread/2f6fad581a037971/a5fcf4c4981d34e6?show_docid=a5fcf4c4981d34e6](http://groups.google.com/group/vim_dev/browse_thread/thread/2f6fad581a037971/a5fcf4c4981d34e6?show_docid=a5fcf4c4981d34e6)
- [http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2008:236](http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2008:236)
- [http://www.rdancer.org/vulnerablevim-netrw-credentials-dis.html](http://www.rdancer.org/vulnerablevim-netrw-credentials-dis.html)

- [http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/495436](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/495436)

- [http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/44419](http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/44419)
